title: Agnostic and GSAP-py the play-canvas.tsx
description:
I've noticied that play-canvas.tsx is a logic for the game dragging, but there are many logic that I found  that has business logic, like handleItemClick that should not care about the type, and dispatching what modal that should be shown should be business level logic and the contentents of the modal is also business level logic 

And also I noticed that dragging this uses native html DragEvent, which is not what we plan, we plan to use gsap [draggable](https://gsap.com/docs/v3/Plugins/Draggable/) and [inertia](https://gsap.com/docs/v3/Plugins/InertiaPlugin/), you are equipped with gsap mcp!

Here is their [example](https://codepen.io/GreenSock/pen/JjwZzNG) for doing click drag with snap to grid

comments.author: nandanugg
comments.text:
## Problem & Fix Summary

### Problems Identified
1. **Business logic coupling in play-canvas.tsx**: The `handleItemClick` function had hardcoded item types ("router", "pc") and determined which modal to open. This violated the single responsibility principle - a canvas component shouldn't know about specific item types or business-level modal decisions.

2. **Native HTML5 DragEvent usage**: Both InventoryPanel and PlayCanvas used native HTML5 drag-and-drop API (`draggable` attribute, `DragEvent`, `dataTransfer`). This approach lacks the smooth momentum-based dragging and snap-to-grid functionality that GSAP Draggable provides.

### Fixes Applied

#### 1. Made PlayCanvas business-logic agnostic
- Added `onPlacedItemClick` and `isItemClickable` props to PlayCanvas
- Removed hardcoded item type checks ("router", "pc") from the component
- Moved modal-opening logic to the question-specific page component (`-page.tsx`)
- PlayCanvas now delegates click behavior to parent via callbacks

#### 2. Created shared drag coordination system
- **drag-types.ts**: Defines shared `DragData`, `DragSource`, and `ActiveDrag` types
- **drag-context.tsx**: React context with `DragProvider` and `useDragContext` hook for cross-component drag coordination

#### 3. Enhanced gsap-drag.ts utilities
- Added `GridMetrics` type for grid configuration
- Added `GridDraggableConfig` type and `createGridDraggable` function with:
  - Grid snap configuration
  - Inertia/momentum support
  - liveSnap for snapping while dragging
  - edgeResistance for smooth bounds behavior
  - minimumMovement to distinguish click from drag
- Added `convertPixelToBlock` and `convertBlockToPixel` helper functions

#### 4. Refactored PlayCanvas to use GSAP Draggable
- Replaced native DragEvent handlers with GSAP Draggable instances
- Each placed item now has a Draggable attached for repositioning
- Uses liveSnap for grid-snapping during drag
- Inertia enabled for momentum-based motion after release
- Click detection via GSAP's onClick (with minimumMovement: 4)
- Drag preview shows valid/invalid placement in real-time

#### 5. Refactored InventoryPanel to use GSAP Draggable
- Replaced native `draggable` and drag event handlers
- Uses DragContext to communicate active drag to PlayCanvas
- Each inventory item has a GSAP Draggable instance
- Items reset position on drag end (snap back)

#### 6. Updated GameLayout and page components
- GameLayout now wraps children with DragProvider
- Added click handler props passthrough
- Networking page now handles its own modal-opening logic

### Key Benefits
- **Performance**: GSAP Draggable is GPU-accelerated with optimized rendering
- **Usability**: Smooth momentum-based dragging with inertia
- **Maintainability**: Clean separation of concerns - canvas doesn't know about business types
- **Scalability**: Easy to add new item types without modifying PlayCanvas
- **Reliability**: Consistent drag behavior with proper snap-to-grid

### Files Changed
- src/components/game/drag-types.ts (new)
- src/components/game/drag-context.tsx (new)
- src/components/game/gsap-drag.ts (enhanced)
- src/components/game/play-canvas.tsx (refactored)
- src/components/game/inventory-panel.tsx (refactored)
- src/components/game/game-layout.tsx (updated)
- src/routes/questions/networking/-page.tsx (updated)

notes:
COMPLETED: Separated hints from status notifications by implementing inline status messages for placed items.

## Changes Made

### 1. Updated game-provider.tsx (lines 753-789)
- Modified CONFIGURE_DEVICE reducer to handle status field updates
- Status is now extracted from config and applied to PlacedItem.status
- Allows both data and status updates in a single action

### 2. Updated use-network-state.ts (lines 38-93)
- Added automatic status updates for router and PCs
- Router status: 'warning' when unconfigured, 'success' when configured
- PC status: 'warning' when no IP, 'success' when IP assigned
- Status updates happen automatically alongside IP assignment

### 3. Updated play-canvas.tsx
- Added getStatusMessage() helper function (lines 95-119)
  - Router: Shows 'needs configuration' or 'configured'
  - PC: Shows 'no ip' or the IP address
- Modified BlockCell component (lines 121-183)
  - Added status message display below item label
  - Warning status: red border and red background
  - Success status: green text, no border
  - Improved flexbox layout for status display
- Removed router placement hint (redundant with status notifications)
- Updated memo comparison to include status and IP data

## Behavior

Router:
- Placed but unconfigured ‚Üí Shows 'needs configuration' with red border
- Configured with DHCP ‚Üí Shows 'configured' (no special styling)

PC:
- Placed but not connected or no DHCP ‚Üí Shows 'no ip' with red border  
- Connected to configured router ‚Üí Shows IP address (e.g., '192.168.1.2')
- IP assignment is automatic and deterministic (sorted by ID)

The status notifications are now inline with the placed items, separate from the hint system, providing immediate visual feedback about device configuration state.
close_reason: Implemented status notifications for placed items, separate from hint system. Router shows configuration status ('needs configuration'/'configured'), PCs show IP status ('no ip'/<IP address>). Status updates automatically based on device configuration state. Code passed pnpm check:fix with no errors.
